parsed.internal_thinking: After analyzing the board, AI_1 and AI_2 have taken strong positions with 12 pips each (Node 20 and Node 42). As AI_3, I have the advantage of placing my first and second settlements back-to-back. My primary goal for the first placement is to secure the highest available production. Node 12 stands out with 11 total pips, providing Wood (3), Brick (6), and Sheep (5). This is a strong starting combination for early road and settlement expansion. It is also safely distant from the existing settlements at 20 and 42. By securing Node 12 now, I can follow up with a second placement that targets Wheat and Ore (likely Node 25 or Node 44) to ensure a balanced economy. Node 12's adjacency to the 6-Brick is particularly valuable as it's the highest-yielding Brick tile on the board, which I will share with AI_1. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: I am placing my first settlement on Node 12 (W3, B6, S5). My second placement should focus on Wheat and Ore to balance my resources. Node 25 (Wh8, S4, O3) or Node 44 (Wh6, Wh9, O2) are the primary targets for the next turn. I should plan to build roads toward Node 13 or 14 to secure more Wheat production early on.
parsed.say_outloud: I'll take the spot near the mountains and forests at node 12. It looks like a great place to start building, and sharing that 6-Brick with AI_1 should help us both get some roads down early!
